intro: Capsella odontophylla, commonly known as the toothed knotweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant has small, white flowers that bloom in early spring, and its leaves are characterized by their toothed margins. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields and along roadsides. Capsella odontophylla is an annual plant, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
